content.description: A pretty and popular east Chandler problem. Slightly contrived. Start on the face a few feet to the right of the cool square arete. Climb up a series of crimps staying off the arete. Finish on the shelf at the top left. An eliminate but good quality.
content.location: In the main Lost City trail area. On the boulder directly north of the concrete fire pit.

content.description: Crux is just before getting halfway up the route. Fun, lead on small and somewhat tricky gear.
content.protection: Mostly wires and small tricams though small cams up to a BD #1 may be helpful. 2 bolts on top of the wall (requires ~5ft of webbing to reach over the edge)
content.location: After walking down the steps, twin cracks begins just right of an arête with an top access gully about 30ft right (just below the blue spray painted arrow). Mostly use the middle of the 3 prominent right angling cracks (that starts from the arête) for hands and gear

content.description: Climbs the right (NE) arete of the Stryper Wall. Start just left of the arete.
content.location: Stryper Wall, 50 yards west of East Chandler

content.description: Short, sustained route that climbs the left hand side of the SE (left) arete of the Stryper Wall
content.protection: Gear and/or webbing to build a TR
content.location: Left arete of the Stryper Wall that starts above a boulder stuck into the sloping hillside

content.description: An uncharacteristically thuggy problem for area. Start in the undercling. Move to a large and comfortable left hand pinch. Set up your feet and get completely horizontal sticking a sloping jug 5ft diagonally right. Opt out of the chossy top out and downclimb the ramp instead. Careful to pad out the concrete firepit.
content.protection: Multiple pads for the wild finish move and the concrete fire pit beneath it.
content.location: Just south of the fire pit in the middle of the Lost City trail area of East Chandler.

content.description: A beautiful looking wall with a couple diagonal cracks and rails running up the length of it. Follow the cracks and sloping rail up and to the right. Finish on the apex of the boulder to the right of the tree resting on the face.
content.protection: Multiple pads or a top rope setup.
content.location: The northernmost boulder in East Chandler. Just downhill from Wings of Steel. Hard to miss.

content.description: A rarely climbed line. Follows the brown streak on the face all the way up and slightly left finishing on the apex of the face.
content.protection: A top rope or lots of pads
content.location: In the center of the East Chandler area. South of the concrete fire pit.

content.description: An ultra technical traverse. Ride the stunning undercling rail that runs the entire length of the wall. Start on the left by Wings of Steel and traverse right ending on the west corner or vertical crack. Often wet.
content.location: In the main Lost City trail area. On the boulder directly north of the concrete fire pit. North face.

content.description: Traverse the south face of the Wings of Steel boulder. Start on the cool square arete. Traverse left to Broken Wings and topout in the large crack.
content.location: In the main Lost City trail area. On the boulder directly north of the concrete fire pit. South face.

content.description: An uncommonly dynamic boulder for Chandler Park. Climbs directly up the middle of the vertical/slightly overhanging face on the Buttermilk Mustache block. Start matched in a block-shaped notch, move through another good hold and a couple of intermediates into a precise dyno or desperate deadpoint to slot jugs at the top. A fun one definitely worth trying especially with its proximity to another classic.
content.location: On the Buttermilk Mustache block. Walk 500 ft east along the cliffline from the East Chandler area where the "Lost City Trail" sign is. A jutting arete appears on the right.

content.description: Start on the flat undercling and move to the sharp LH sidepull. Deadpoint to a bad crimp and keep it together to reach the flat ledge. Downclimb the ramp.

This variation was quite popular and allows you to work the upper moves of the boulder, skipping the lower crux.Jump Start: Grab a sharp LH sidepull and jumpstart/deadpoint to a RH crimp. Make a couple crimpy moves to the flat jugs. Downclimb the ramp.The original start goes at V6/7 and starts matched on the flat undercling.
content.location: Just a few feet right of the North American in the middle of the face.

content.description: Start 5ft right of Wings of Steel. Climb straight up and straight right into a faint wide runnel. Top out on the flake shelf.
content.location: In the main Lost City trail area. On the boulder directly north of the concrete fire pit. Runs up the middle of the north face.

content.description: Thin holds and flakes lead up the right side of an attractive face.
content.protection: 2 bolts and 2 bolt anchor (replaced Nov 2021 thanks to the American Safe Climbing Association).First bolt is high - stickclip or crash pad is recommended for the start.
content.location: Around the corner from Twin Cracks.

content.description: Climbs 5ft left of Men at Work up the left side of the face. Climb through the vertical ripples, into the ugly runnel, and to the top. Stays off the left shelf that forms near the top.
content.location: Lost City trail main area. East of the concrete fire pit

content.description: Short climb on the narrow east facing column. A great candidate for rebolting if we can get park permission.
content.protection: 2 bolts and 2 bolt anchor (replaced Nov 2021 thanks to the American Safe Climbing Association).
content.location: East chandler between Cubik and Twin Cracks

content.description: Just right of the left (SE) arete on the Stryper Wall. Climbs past 3 bolts to anchors.
content.protection: 3 bolts + anchors. Bolts are old and need replaced.

content.description:
WARNING: Currently has a huge death block on it at about 12ft up.

 Difficult moves on overhung terrain leads to a couple really big reaches on big holds.
content.protection: Boulder or TR by tying a sling around an upper branch on the tree just left of the route.
content.location: After walking down the steps, walk until the wall on the right turns right a little. At the corner of the wall, there is some loose rock. Cubik climbs just left of the choss under the overhang and onto the face

content.description: A classic Chandler problem in the eastern area of the park. Sit start. Crimping and technical footwork leads up an awesome arete to a crux 10 ft up. A must-do.
content.location: Hike down from the "Lost City Trail" parking just before the main area parking. Walk east (right) along the cliffline for 500 ft and the arete is just south of the rundown pavilion.

content.description: Climb straight up the large crack on the SW face of the Wings of Steel boulder. Located just NW of the concrete fire pit.
content.location: NW of the concrete fire pit

content.description: A very worthwhile sector consisting of quality top ropes, boulders, and traverses.
